The problem with Essence Reaver for ADCs is that only a few of them can make really good use out of Essence Flare.

{{champion:22}} : High CD ult. Secondly, her ult is either used as an initiation tool from longer range (meaning, Essence Flare's activation timer could run out) or saved as an emergency tool (meaning Essence Flare does not activate unless you need to vacate the fight like right now).
{{champion:51}} : Does not use her ult in fights, similar problems to Ashe.
{{champion:42}} : Spams his ult too much to make optimal use of Essence Flare.
{{champion:119}} : Mainly uses his ult as a kill secure/finisher.
{{champion:81}} : Has other item needs.
{{champion:222}} : See Draven and Ashe.
{{champion:145}} : Possible ER user. Problem is, ult has a long CD - and there are better options for her itemization currently available.
{{champion:429}} : Cannot use her ult in fights just for a steroid's sake.
{{champion:96}} : Same as Corki - his ult is, in fact, too spammable.
{{champion:236}} : Possible ER user. Prefers Black Cleaver due to its lower focus and lower dependency on ult, though.
{{champion:21}} : Spends half of ER's activation window ulting.
{{champion:133}} : Personally like ER on her, due to Essence Flare window only opening when using Skystrike/leaving ult. However, Stormrazor is more popular on her.
{{champion:15}} : Prefers Stormrazor for the Crit proc.
{{champion:18}} : Ult is a major safety tool and too liberal use can screw your teammates over.
{{champion:110}} : Potential user. Current build prefers Rageblade, though.
{{champion:67}} : Potential user, since her ult is a steroid anyways. However, does not need CdR nor mana sustain nearly as much.
{{champion:498}} : Ult is a major safety tool, again.

I think all it needs is some tuning. 

The concept is cool; use your ult, and get a short window of badassery. It sells that concept pretty well. If they wanted to push it, maybe have you get a chunk of mana when Essence Flare activates, or reduce your mana costs while it is active, so that even if you activate it at low mana, you still get to spam spells for a while.

The root of the problem is Stormrazor. Why turn that B.F Sword into Essence Reaver when you could get Stormrazor, getting more sustained damage and mobility for less gold. 

Already have Stormrazor? RFC synergizes so well with it that it'd be a shame not to grab that, too. After that, you're looking for a defensive item, not damage, so a GA, Bloodthirster, etc. is probably what you wanna go for. 

Stormrazor needs a nerf, and maybe a slight buff to Essence Reaver to make sure its the better option in its niche. It's supposed to be for "caster" ADCs like Corki, Lucian, or Kai'Sa, not just for everybody.

I honestly think Stormrazor needs to be removed entirely. I don't think there's anyway to fix it, and it'll just become one of those pains in the asses like Duskblade has become if they keep trying to preserve it without killing it's most problematic elements.

It has potential to be a good item. They actually had a pretty good concept before they scrapped it for this monstrosity.

It used to be this:

UNIQUE Passive: If you haven't attacked in the last 2.5 seconds, your next basic attack will critically strike.
UNIQUE Passive: When you critically strike, gain 25% attack speed and 8% movement speed for 1.5 seconds.

Nerf the first passive even more and keep the second one.

Ideally:

> {{item:3095}} 3000g
>
> {{item:1038}} + {{item:1037}} + {{item:1042}} + 525g
>
> +65 AD
> +25% Attack Speed
> 
> UNIQUE: If you haven't basic attacked for 3 − 0.3 (based on bonus attack speed) seconds, gain STORM'S EDGE.
.
> UNIQUE – STORM'S EDGE: Your next basic attack critically strikes for 125% − 200% (based on critical strike chance) damage.
.
> UNIQUE Passive: When you critically strike, gain 25% attack speed and 8% movement speed for 1.5 seconds.

Dunno why they scrapped this for the current one.

StormR is not the problem in this case.

No adc would start EssenceR right now even if StormR didn't existed because you are delaying too much the crit they need.
You just cant play champs like Ashe-Xayah-Sivir without crit.

In fact Ashe is the best example of what I'm saying: a champ that had old ER as core item and that for her StormR doesn't exist and yet she never buys new ER.

Imo they should make ER a mana-cdr-crit item again and make other new item for the Essence Flare active because both concepts cant be on the same item in a healthy way.

It's not worthless, it works exceeding well on people who can use it - it's a niche item, which is what all items should honestly strive to be. It's main problem is that Stormrazor outclasses everything, so as long as that item exists, Essence Reaver will always be eclipsed.
Essence Reaver isn't just outclassed by StormR, this ER is straight up bad on the old ER users and they wouldn't even buy It if StormR didn't exist.

They should just give ER its 20% crit back, as well as remove Srormrazor and it'll be fine. It would build like this:

Caster ADC (Lucian, Xayah, Sivir, etc):
1. Essence Reaver (20% crit)
2. Zeal item (50% crit)
3. infinity Edge (100% crit)

Non Caster ADC (Tristana, Jinx, Caitlyn, etc):
1. BF Sword into Zeal item (30% crit)
2. Infinity Edge (60% crit)
3. Zeal item (100% crit)

All ADCs (save for on-hit) will have a decent 3 item powerspike that can be tuned with individual scaling as needed. Get rid of Stormrazor and return ER to what it used to be.

The amount of mana it gives you back is laughable. You are either playing a champ that is mana hungry and gets tear anyway because it is just better, or someone who doesn't have mana issues. Whoever you play and get this item on, get team instead. your win rate will jump up.
